Package gui.controllers

Class ViewSupplierOrdersScreenController

java.lang.Object
gui.controllers.ViewSupplierOrdersScreenController
All Implemented Interfaces:
javafx.fxml.Initializable
public class ViewSupplierOrdersScreenController extends Object implements javafx.fxml.Initializable
Controller for the screen where a supplier can view and manage orders. This includes refreshing the list of awaiting orders, approving orders, and updating orders to "Ready".

    • onApproveClicked

      private void onApproveClicked(javafx.event.ActionEvent event) throws Exception
      Handles the event when the approve button is clicked. Updates the status of the selected order to "Approved". Prepares and sends an order status update to the customer.
      Parameters:
      event - the action event
      Throws:
      Exception - if updating the order status fails

    • onRefreshClicked

      private void onRefreshClicked(javafx.event.ActionEvent event) throws Exception
      Handles the event when the refresh button is clicked. Fetches the latest awaiting orders and updates the list.
      Parameters:
      event - the action event
      Throws:
      Exception - if refreshing the orders fails

    • onUpdateReadyClicked

      private void onUpdateReadyClicked(javafx.event.ActionEvent event) throws Exception
      Handles the event when the update ready button is clicked. Updates the status of the selected order to "Ready". Prepares and sends an order status update to the customer based on the order type (Takeaway or Delivery).
      Parameters:
      event - the action event
      Throws:
      Exception - if updating the order status fails

    • sendOrderStatusUpdate

      private void sendOrderStatusUpdate(String customerIDString, String message, String title, String header)
      Sends an order status update to a client and displays an alert based on the response.
      Parameters:
      customerIDString - The customer ID as a string.
      message - The message to be sent and displayed in the alert.
      title - The title of the alert dialog.
      header - The header text of the alert dialog.

    • problemAlert

      private void problemAlert()
      Displays an informational alert to the user indicating a problem with the order simulation.

    • isValidTimeFormat

      private boolean isValidTimeFormat(String time)
      Validates whether a given string represents a valid time in the format HH:mm.
      Parameters:
      time - the string to be validated
      Returns:
      true if the string is in a valid time format and represents a valid time; false otherwise
